result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamonte A Weathers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lamonte A Weathers appeared by video.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty appeared by video for Lamonte A Weathers.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Lamonte A Weathers in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court for Lamonte A Weathers.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense needs additional time to review discovery. Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Report Received and Filed.

Defendant Lamonte A Weathers in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Lamonte A Weathers.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Defense needs discovery, has received an offer. Case is adjourned in Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
The Judge's explanation is outlined on the submitted order.

Court ordered no contact with Kopp's at 5373 N. Port Washington Rd., Glendale, WI
and La Quinta at 5423 N. Port Washington Rd., Glendale WI.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lamonte A Weathers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III appeared by video for Lamonte A Weathers. Attorney Michael J. Odden appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference.
This hearing MAY be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/104d9737-ba2f-8811-9083-aed2135824d9
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
